question_answer.statement: A two-story house with a soft first floor collapsed during the 2022 Michoacan earthquake.
The partial collapse of a court cover roof in Colola, Michoacan, was due to severe rust.
The 2022 Michoacan earthquake caused damage to a community hospital and nearby buildings.
The 2022 Michoacan earthquake caused extensive cracking on walls and floor lifting in Ciudad Guzman, Jalisco.

question_answer.question: What type of damage was noted along roads and highways within 50 km of the epicenter of the 2022 Michoacan earthquake?

question_answer.statement: Severe longitudinal cracking on roads can be a result of lateral expansion caused by earthquakes.

options: A. Opening of joints and vertical cracking

question_answer.statement: The 2022 Michoacan earthquake caused lateral displacements of decks and damage in pier caps of bridges.
The culvert in Coahuayana, Michoacan, was made of stones in mortar.
The landslides and rockslides observed in Michoacan were primarily re-activations of earlier failures.

question_answer.question: What phenomenon was noted in La Zapotera, El Ticuiz, Ixtapilla, and Maruata following the earthquake?
What phenomenon was observed near Ixtapilla, Michoacan, following the earthquake?

question_answer.statement: Lateral spreading in beach sands due to liquefaction occurred in El Ticuiz, Michoacan during the 2022 earthquake.
Sand boils are a phenomenon that can occur during an earthquake.
Lateral spreading and cracking in rural roads can occur due to liquefaction during an earthquake.
Lateral spreading in beach deposits near Coahuayana, Michoacan occurred immediately after the 2022 earthquake.
